data.description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers). The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

This field is a fixed account segement, recording information related to a project; for example, construction projects which require a separate accounting. The value of this field stored is Project_ID. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table through GL_Account_Segment.

This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts. The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number, and we can get more information of a certain bank account in the BAS_Bank_Account table. Shall match the Bank_Account_Number in the BAS_Bank_Account table through GL_Account_Segment.
Reserved field that shall be used for supplementary information associated with particular account. The 'X' signifies that each unique account segment will be captured in a separate field.
Line 1 of the street address.
Line 2 of the street address.
City name of this address.
The state or province of this address (ISO 3166-2).
The postal code of the city of this address.
The country code of this address (ISO 3166-1).
Amount in functional or group currency.
The code of functional or group currency related to the balance (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
Amount in transaction currency.
The code of currency used in the actual transaction (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
Amount in reporting currency.
The code of currency used for non-consolidated reporting as opposed to functional, consolidated reporting, local or actual amounts (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
Amount in local currency.
The code of currency used for local country reporting requirements (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The unique identifier for the adjustment of record. Typically auto-generated by the system.

The number of the adjustment of record. The number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system based rules.This number may need to be created by concatenating fields to uniquely identify each transaction; for example, serial number, document type, and adjustment date.

The name of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the supplier; for example, credit memo, debit memo, finance charge and other adjustments.

The number of an internally generated adjustment document; for example, credit memo. The number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system based rules; for example, document number, document type, and year.

The unique identifier for each invoice, from which AP is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field represents the invoice against which the adjustment is applied, if relevant. May be set to NULL if adjustment is at supplier (not invoice) level. Shall match the Invoice_ID in the PUR_Invoices_Received table.
The unique identifier for journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Journal_ID in the GL_Details table.

Fiscal year in which the Adjustment_Date occurs.  The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Adjustment_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.
The date of the adjustment, regardless of the date the adjustment is created.

The unique identifier for the supplier from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.
The number of GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
The number of GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the adjustment of record. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Adjustment_ID in the AP_Adjustments table.
The unique identifier for the adjustment line. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the line item of the adjustment of record. The number is usually generated by manual input or automated using system based rules.

The unique identifier for each invoice, from which AP is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field represents the invoice against which the adjustment is applied, if relevant. May be set to NULL if adjustment is at supplier (not invoice) level. Shall match the Invoice_ID in the PUR_Invoices_Received table.

The unique identifier for an invoice line.Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if adjustment is at supplier (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_Line_ID in the PUR_Invoices_Received_Details table.
The unique identifier for journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Journal_ID in the GL_Details table.

The number of GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Accounting period in which the AP_Application_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.
The date of the cash application transaction, regardless of the date the transaction is created.

The calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.
The calendar ending date of the current accounting period.
The number of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center. ISO 13616  is recommended if applicable.
The name of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.
The code of the financial institution ((ISO 9362 or ISO 17442). ISO 17442 is preferred. One reason is that bank branch identifier will not change due to location movement.
The full name of the institution for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.
The code of the institution's branch.
The full name of the institution's branch.

Sub-region within country; in the U.S., this would be a state; in Canada it would be a province.
This indicates whether the bank account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

The code of the bill type; for example, using 004 to represent bank draft, 005 to represent promissory note, 006 to represent check.
The name of the bill type; for example, bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check.
This indicates whether the bill type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The code of each business segment.
The name of the business segment.
The relative level of the segment with 1 being the consolidated level and numbers increasing through lower levels of the organizational chart.
Indicate the name of the organization type, for example 'Department' and  'Cost Center'.
The code of the parent business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment _Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The code of the child business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The GL account number.
The name for the GL account.
The label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number.
The financial statement caption represents a related group of accounts; for example, cash and cash equivalents, accounts payable and cost of sales. The caption can be at the trial balance level.
The type of account; for example, assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses.
The subtype of the account; for example, current assets are the subtype of assets.
The corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy; for example, using 1 to represent assets, and 2 to represent the account subtype current assets.

The number of the parent account in an account hierarchy. This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the chart of accounts table.When Parent_GL_Account_Number is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value, for example set to NULL. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

This field is used to indicate whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating 'D' or 'C', where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.
This indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The code of the currency type (ISO 4217, Codes for the representation of currencies).
The name of the currency type in the accounting and/or ERP system.

The unit of recorded value which is a division of the respective unit of currency. Minor unit shows the decimal relationship between such unit and the currency itself (ISO 4217). Number 0 means that there is no minor unit for that currency, whereas number 1, 2, 3, etc. signify a ratio of 10:1, 100:1, 1000:1, etc. respectively.

data.entity_name: EXAMPLE The US cent is a one hundredth part of the US dollar; the GB penny is a one hundredth part of the pound sterling. The minor unit number for both is 2.

data.description: This indicates whether Currency_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The unique identifier for the customer. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the customer. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The name of the customer.
The abbreviation of the customer's name.
The unique identifier for the parent customer. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.
The unique identifier for the corresponding supplier in case that the customer is also a supplier. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table. Otherwise set NULL.
The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the BAS_Customer_Type table.
The customer's tax identification number. This number is usually generated by tax regulator.
The date that the customer was declared inactive. For example a customer may become inactive due to exceeding credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy etc.
The per invoice credit limit established for this customer.
The credit limit for this customer's total outstanding balance.

The discount percentage the customer can take if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.

The number of days from the invoice date the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places; for example, 10 days would be represented as 10.
The default number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system.

The code of the customer type; for example, using 004 to represent a Platinum customer, 005 to represent a Gold customer and 006 to represent a Silver customer. BAS_Customer_Type_Code and BAS_Customer_Type_Name are not necessarily related.
The name of the type categorized by the customer attributes; for example, platinum customer, gold customer and silver customer.
The unique identifier for the parent customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the

The code of customized account segment which audit data needs to be used; this does not include the fixed account segment having been identified; for example, unlike customer, budget information is not included in the base module as an individual table, therefore budget can be identified as a customized segment.
The customized account segment name which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget records planned revenue and expenditure.

The customized account segment description which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget can be described as the annual plan of aggregated fiscal revenue and expenditure for a state, which is verified and approved through legal procedures.

The encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment. If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by '-'; for example, budget (with 1-digit code, like 1) can be subdivided into financial budget (with 2-digit code, like 01) and construction budget (with 2-digit code, like 05), with the financial budget containing budgeted revenue (with 2-digit code, like 03) and budgeted expenditure (with 2-digit code, like 04), which are the third level segments. In this case, Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2.
Whether the table value has a hierarchy feature or not. '1' means 'yes', '0' means 'no'.
This indicates whether the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The code of the customized account segment value. If the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2, the corresponding budget-financial budget-budgeted expenditure is 10104.
This field is associated with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the AS_Customized_ACC_Segment table.
The name of the account segment value of each file. EXAMPLE budget,  financial budget,  budgeted expenditure.
The detailed description of the account segment value.
The code of the parent customized account segment value. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Value_Code in BAS_Customized_ACC_Value table.
The level of the current value in the file structure. For example,  '1' means 'the highest'.
The unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.

The code of the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone does part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID in this table. And the part time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code.
The name of the employee.
Indicate whether one employee is active or inactive. One employee may become inactive due to some reasons such as sabbatical.

The code of the employee types. For example, using 004 to represent an on-the job employee, 005 to represent a retired employee, 006 to represent a deceased employee, 007 to represent a part time employee.
The name of the employee type. For example, employed, retired, probation and part-time.
The code of department rosters. For example, the IT department is designated as code 0018. The code shall match the Business_Segment_code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The job title of the person in an accounting unit. For example, accounting manager.
The highest academic degree acquired; for example Doctor, Master.
The employment date of the employee.
The termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.
The system user ID associated with the employee. The ID shall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.
The code of the journal entry type; for example, using 004 to represent a cash receipt entry, 005 to represent a cash disbursement entry, 006 to represent a non-cash entry.

The name of the journal entry type. This is usually categorized by business to satisfy an internal control need and/or to facilitate sorting and querying; for example, journal entries could be classified based on whether the transaction involves cash. In this case there may be cash receipt entry, cash disbursement entry, and non-cash entry of adjusting that is the recording of interest revenue earned and wages payable, estimation that is the recording depreciation, and bad-debt expenses, and/or correction that makes entries to counteract the effects of errors found in the general ledger.
The abbreviation of the journal entry type.
This indicates whether the JE type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The code of the measurement unit.
The name of the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the material.
The abbreviation of the measurement unit's name; for example, kilogram is recorded as 'kg' and square meter is recorded as 'sq.m'.
This indicates whether the UOM_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

The code of the payment term; for example, terms of 2/10, net 60 could be quoted. This means that customers have 60 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. However, if payment is made within 10 days, a 2 percent cash discount can be taken.
The full name of the payment term.
The number of the lines according to the Payment_Term_Code value. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The detailed description of the payment term's line; for example, payment due date, discount days, discount percentage.
data.sample_values: Payment date is 30 days after invoice date.

data.description: This indicates whether the payment term is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The number of the current data collection. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The name of the current data collection.
The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The date shall be shown as 'YYYY-MM-DD' in the extended format and the YYYY indicates a fourdigit year (ISO 8601-1).
The legal name of accounting entity.
The corresponding industry name under superior sector code.
The name of accounting and/or ERP system software developer.
The name of accounting and/or ERP system software products.
The accounting and/or ERP system software version.
The functional or group currency used in accounting and/or ERP system software (ISO 4217).
The standard issuing No. of the standards with which the current output files are consistent; for example, ISO 21378.
The date of data extraction.

The Time_Zone indicates the difference between local time and UTC of day. The representation of the difference can be expressed in hours and minutes, or hours only. The Time_Zone shall be shown as '�}hh:mm in the extended format (ISO 8601-1). EXAMPLE Newfoundland's time zone =-03:30, Beijing's time zone=+08:00.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The code of each project.
The name of the project related to operation and administration.
The beginning date of the project.
The ending date of the project.
This indicates whether the project is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

The code of the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money; for example,  001 for cash, 002 for bills, 003 for credit card, 004 for remittance, and 005 for bank collection.
The name of the settlement method; for example, cash settlement, issuing bills, credit card, bank remittance and bank collection.
This indicates whether the settlement method is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.
The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied.Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. The number is usually generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The name of the supplier.
The abbreviation form of the supplier's name.
The unique identifier of the parent supplier. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

The unique identifier for the corresponding customer in case that the supplier is also a customer. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table. Otherwise set NULL.
The unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID in the BAS_Supplier_Type table.
The supplier's tax identification number. The number is usually generated by the tax regulator.
For supplier group assignments when the organization segments the suppliers.
The date the supplier was declared inactive. For example a supplier may become inactive due to exceeding credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy etc.
The per invoice credit limit established for this supplier.
The credit limit for the total outstanding balance approved for the supplier.

The discount percentage the supplier can provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.
The number of days from the invoice date the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places; for example, 10 would represent 10 days.
The number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
The unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The code of the supplier type; for example, using 004 to represent preferred suppliers, 005 to represent key suppliers, 006 to represent common suppliers.
The name of the type categorized by the supplier attributes; for example, preferred supplier, key supplier and common supplier.
The unique identifier for the parent supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID in the BAS_Supplier_Type table.
The code of the regulator or jurisdiction.
The country code where the regulator is located (ISO 3166-1).
The sub-region within country; For example, in the U.S., this would be state and in Canada it would be province.
The name of the regulator for which tax is withheld or accrued.
The role of the regulator: federal, regional or local.
The GL account used to reflect amounts payable to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table. GL_Account_Name.
The GL account used to reflect accruals due to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
The GL account used to reflect expense related to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
The ID assigned / generated by the regulator for the reporting organization to the regulator.
The code of the reporting organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
This indicates whether the Regulator_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

A code used to refer to this tax type, used as a key or cross-reference in files; for example, using 004 to represent the income tax, 005 to represent the tariff, 006 to represent the value added tax.
The name of the tax type; for example, income tax, tariff and value added tax.
The code of the regulator for this tax. Shall match the Regulator_Code in the BAS_Tax_Regulatory table.
The description of the tax type.
The description of the tax code, subdivision of the tax type; for example, lower percentage applicable for common goods.
Default percentage for this combination of tax type and tax code. Can as of the Extracted_Date from Profile table.

The unique identifier for the individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on the fields Created_User_ID, Last_Modified_User_ID, Approved_User_ID and Posted_User_ID, respectively.
Indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive. A user may become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination etc. For example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

The job title of the person in the system; for example, system manager.

Free form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility. For example, responsibility related to managing the information of accounts payable in the system.
Name of the contact.
The phone number of the contact.
The email address of the contact.

The ending date of the contract.

The code of the person who is responsible for purchase contracts. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction (i.e. the debit or credit amount) amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer or the supplier. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

Accounting period in which the financial statement occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The number of the Account_Segment. Case 1 If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by Account_Segment_Name of the record. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.entity_name: Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as  Account_Segment_Employee.
Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, like welfare expenditure.

data.description: The table corresponding to account segment.

data.entity_name: Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS_Employee for  Account_Segment_Employee.

Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment.

Case 3 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and there is a table contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the table's name, such as BAS_Customer.

data.description: The detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name.
The code of the customized account segment. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the BAS_ Customized_ACC_Segment table.
The unique identifier for each journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.

Accounting period in which the Effective_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1 -Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or entered. This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date; for example, if the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20X1, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20X1.

The number of the bill. A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrust the drawee at sight; a specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities. The per unit price of the inventory or PPE. This field is associated with Quantity and Amount; for example, if the account is inventory or PPE, we can multiply Quantity by Unit_Price to get total line Amount.

Indicates whether the amount is a credit or debit. 'C' = credit; 'D' = debit.
Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed. '1' = entry is a reversal, '2' = entry is being reversed, and empty ('') = none of the above or system generated indicators.
When the Reversal Indicator Code = 1, this identifies the Journal_ID of the entry being reversed.
The sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted. For example,  0=entry is not cancelled,  1=entry is cancelled.

The unique identifier for the inventory product type used to express inventory or product type with hierarchy. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_Type_ID in the INV_Product_Type table.
Product descriptor #1.
Product descriptor #2.
Universal Product Code or other external identifier. For example, the product code from a primary supplier.

The unique identifier for the supplier that the organization has designated as the first choice from whom to procure this item. Selection may be for contractual or practical reasons, which may include historical reliability and quality, advantageous terms (e.g. delivery or pricing), specific customer request, or other reasons. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID from the BAS_Supplier table.

The code of the basic measurement unit for inventory, which cannot be further separated; for example, the basic measurement unit for pencil is pieces, however, the business can also use boxes as measurement unit for stocking or managerial purpose. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
Description of the costing method; for example, LIFO, FIFO, average, standard, and specific identification.

The code of the measurement unit that stock is normally used; for example, to measure pencils for stocking purpose, boxes as measurement unit is usually used, which is different from the basic measurement unit pieces. Shall match the UOM_Code in the

The number of GL account on which the balance sheet amount of inventory product is recognized; for example, identifier for the raw inventory account. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

The number of GL account on which the income statement amount of inventory product is recognized; for example, identifier for the cost of sales account. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.
The date the inventory is out of service; for example, the date when inventory is discontinued due to changes in design and replacement of materials.
The sign of out-of-service status; for example 0 means  no,  and 1 means yes.
The number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
The number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing (e.g. a company purchases 10 computers, with each computer be assigned a individual serial number).

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the inventory product type used to express inventory or product type with hierarchy. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The code of inventory type, for example, '01'= 'raw materials', '02'='work in- progress', '03'='finished goods', '04'='supplies'.
The name of the inventory product type; for example, raw materials, work inprogress, finished goods and supplies.
The description of the inventory product type.

The unique identifier for the parent inventory product type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_Type_ID of the record of parent inventory type in the INV_Product_Type table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the picking ticket, shipping notice, or other document created upon or associated with movement. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the line number for a document other than a customer order, or supplier purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table.
The unique identifier for the customer order, (supplier) purchase order or other document associated with the transaction. Typically auto-generated by the system.

The unique identifier for the line item from a customer order, (supplier) purchase order, to differentiate between multiple items in a single order for different quantities. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The date of activity, per associated transaction document if applicable.
The time of the activity, per associated transaction document if applicable.

Captures information regarding movements and adjustments.  Movement types may include: receipt, shipment, transfer, return, moved to production, moved from production. Quantity adjustment types may include: physical count adjustment, damage, obsolete, scrapped. Cost adjustments may include: lower of cost or market realization.
Transaction code local to the underlying accounting software system.
Description of the transaction.

Quantity affected expressed in location stocking organization in Basic_UOM_Code. When the inventory is received, the number involved will be a 'positive number'; when the inventory is dispatched, the number involved will be a 'negative number'.
The unique identifier for the supplier. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.
The unique identifier for the inventory document, specifying the sources where inventory originates. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the inventory document. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, '201305020001'.
The unique identifier for the inventory document line. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the inventory document line. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The status of the inventory document; for example, 'new', 'save', 'submit', 'void' and 'frozen'.

The code of the inventory organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table. Inventory Organization refers to the organizational unit, physical or virtual, where the inventory transaction and balances may be tracked and monitored. It provides inventory information to modules like purchase and sales. The simplest form of inventory organization is warehouse.
The code of the measurement unit used associated with the quantity used for stocking inventory. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The code of the measurement unit for inventory's cost. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The unique identifier for the inventory item. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.
The number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
The number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing (e.g. a company purchases 10 computers, with each computer be assigned a individual serial number).
The person or organization that makes requisition for inventory.
The unique identifier for the stock trading source location. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Location_ID in the INV_Location table.
The unique identifier for the stock trading destination. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Location_ID in the INV_Location table.

The code of the cost organization, which refers to the organizational unit/level where the cost of outbound inventory will be calculated. The calculation may be done at the corporate level, the stocking organization level or at the particular locations where inventory is stored. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the
Cost per unit using the method found in field Inventory_Cost_Method.
Per unit increase or decrease in stocking cost as represented in field Inventory_Cost_Method of the INV_On_Hand table.
The code of  functional or group currency related to the balance (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.

Indicator used to show whether the inventory transaction is originated within or outside the inventory module.  I for internally initiated transaction and  E  for externally initiated one, for example, purchase or sale.
This indicates whether the inventory is received or dispatched. For example 0 means inventory received,  1 means  inventory dispatched.
The GL account number on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
The GL account number on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the invoice. Typically auto-generated by the system. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data.
The number of the invoice. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, including serial number, document type and date.

Fiscal year in which Invoice_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.
The unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authoritites.
The name of the invoice type. The documents are classified according to business content.
The date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
The date payment is due from the customer. Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

The unique code of the settlement organization (Organization of the payment, can be different from the receiving organization). May be the purchase organization or the receipt organization. Shall match the Unique_Bus_Seg_Code in the
The code value of the method used for cash receipts from customers. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency. No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
The transactional currency appeared in the invoice (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.
The discount percentage can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. Terms are represented as integers to decimal; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.

The number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places; for example, 10 would represent 10 days.
The number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices, for example, the invoice grouping found in certain ERP systems.
The status of the generated invoice; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.
Freeform text description.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the invoice. Typically auto-generated by the system. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data. Shall match the Invoice_ID in the Invoices_Generated table.
The unique identifier for an invoice line. Typically autogenerated by the system.
The number of an internally generated invoice line. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no order. Otherwise shall match the  Order_ID in the Orders table.
The unique identifier for a  order line. Typically autogenerated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no order. Otherwise shall match the  Order_Line_ID in the Orders_Details table.
The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.
The quantity by  basic measurement unit.
The code of the basic measurement unit in invoice, which cannot be further seperated. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The quantity recorded in the invoice line by the measurement unit for product.
The code of the measurement unit for the product. Shall match the UOM_Code in the
The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.
The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.
The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.
The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency. No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices, for example, the invoice grouping found in the certain ERP systems.
The number of GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
The number of GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
Coded identification of the table.
The name of the table.
The date and time the table was created.
Number of records in this table. When a table is split over more then one file this is the total of records within the several table files.
Date and time the file was created.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the order. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.

Fiscal year in which the order occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Order_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The name of the order in sales activities. The types of orders are usually allocated by users of the system according to different business needs; for example, some enterprises will be configured as non contract orders, trial orders, factory orders and store orders.
The date of signing the order. It is the effective date of the order, not the system entered date. The order of a certain period is counted based on the effective date.
The unique code of the sales organization which signed the order. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the salesperson. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.
The code of the person who responsible for purchase orders. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.
The unique identifier for the supplier account in the purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the

The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount (i.e. the debit or credit amount) was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer or the supplier. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.
The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.
The monetary amount recorded in transaction currency.
The transactional currency code specified in the order (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The status of the order; for example, the order has been shipped (goods on the way), the order has been collected, and the order has been completed.
Freeform text description.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Order_ID in the order table.
The unique identifier for a order line. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The line number of the order. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no sales contract. Otherwise shall match the Contract_ID in the Contracts_Details table.
The unique identifier for a contract line. Typically auto generated by the system. Shall match the Contract_Line_ID in the  Contracts_Details table.

The unique identifier for the material purchase requisition. Typically autogenerated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase requisitions. Otherwise shall match the Requisition_ID in the PUR_Requisitions table.

The unique identifier for a material purchase requisition line. A requisition form may apply for purchasing one or more materials. Each material requisitioned should be  described in a seperate row. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase requisitions. Otherwise shall match the Requisition_Line_ID in the PUR_Requisitions_Details table.

The unique identifier for the payer. Typically auto-generated by the system. There are different purchase models in the group company, for example, centralized purchase, decentralized payment, decentralization of procurement and centralized payment. If the sales order customer adopts the centralized purchasing mode, the customer may be a group company, and the settlement organization may be a subsidiary company of the group company. The customer name and the name of the payment customer may be different.

The unique code of the settlement organization. Both parties have settlement unit code, which is used to identify an organization for sales order settlement. Shall match the Settlement_Organization_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

The unique code of the dispatch organization. The dispatch unit refers to the unit who send out goods unit belonging to the seller. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the Business_Segment_Master table.

The unique code of the receiving materials organization (Receiving organization, can be different from the settlement organization). The organization receiving materials may be a warehouse or an administration organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table.
The last requested delivery of products. When an order is delivered in multiple batches, this field refers to the time for the delivery of the last batch.
The quantity by basic measurement unit.
The code of the basic measurement unit in order, which cannot be further seperated. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The quantity of the order line by the measurement unit in order line.
The code of the measurement unit in order line. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.
The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.
The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.
The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.
The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.
The transaction currency amount of order line.
The status of the document line; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the addition entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.

Fiscal year in which the Addition_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Addition_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.
Description of the addition type; for example, purchase, invest and donate.
The date that addition transaction happens.
The reason why the PPE is added.
The quantity of PPE to be added.
Original cost of PPE.
The code of  functional or group currency related to the balance (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the change entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.

Accounting period in which the Change_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The type of change transaction, except for addition or removal transactions. Examples of type of change include revaluations, changes in historical cost, changes in depreciation method, transfers and changes in status.
The date when the changing transaction happens.
The reason why the changing transaction happens.
The content; for example, the method, amount or quantity before changing transaction.
The content; for example, the method, amount or quantity after changing transaction.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.
The depreciation allocation proportion of each department.
The code of department rosters; for example, the department name is IT department, the code is 0018. Shall match the Busieness_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match a PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.

Accounting period in which the Entered_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Remaining useful life of PPE in months as of the report date.
Original cost of PPE.
Residual value of PPE as of the report date. Mostly it is calculated through an expected residual value ratio.
Depreciable basis of PPE, which shows the difference between original cost and residual value.
The amount of the depreciation recognized during the period.
The accumulated depreciation of PPE as of the report date.
The carrying amount of PPE as of the report date, which shows the difference between original cost and accumulated depreciation.

The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recognized for accumulated depreciation. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

The GL account number on which Income Statement amount is recognized for realized gain/loss. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique code of letters and/or numbers used to represent or identify a PPE type. For instance, using 0201 to represent Manufacturing Equipment, using 0202 to represent Working Equipment.
The name of the type categorized by the PPE attributes, for example, land, buildings, machinery and equipment.
The unique identifier for the parent PPE type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Type_ID in the PPE_Type table.
The unique identifier for the shipment receipt. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the receipt. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.

Fiscal year in which the Receipt_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Receipt_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The unique code of the receiving materials organization (Receiving organization, can be different from the settlement organization). The organization receiving materials may be a warehouse or an administration organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The date of the shipment receipt.
The number of the reference receipt. Company reference or logistics company official waybill number.
Monetary amount for the items in the receipt related to the purchase order in transaction currency. This amount is calculated through the receipt details.
The transactional currency appeared in the receipt (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The transportation used for shipping (e.g. air, train, truck, hand delivered).
The organisation or individual responsible for shipping the goods (e.g. UPS, Federal Express).
If the transaction is the original receipt transaction, then 0 ; if the transaction is a receipt adjustment, then 1 .
If an adjustment was made to a receipt, a description should clarify the reason for the adjustment.

The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

The unique identifier for the purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase order. Otherwise shall match the Purchase_Order_ID used in PUR_Orders table.

The unique identifier for a receipt line. Typically auto-generated by the system.

The quantity of materials received recorded in the receipt.

Price per unit for item received (including tax).
Monetary amount for the line item in the receipt document related to the purchase order in transaction currency.

The quantity of the Purchase order line by the purchase measurement unit. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase order.

Purchase order line price per unit. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase order.

The submission date of the purchase requisition.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

The unique identifier for a material purchase requisition line. Typically auto-generated by the system. A requisition form may apply for purchasing one or more materials. Each material requisitioned should be described in a seperate row.

The last requested delivery of the purchased materials in the purchasing requisition. Completion of the delivery shall not be later than that date.

The status of a requisition line; for example, in process or rejected.
